source_references: European Journal of Vascular and Endovascular Surgery

content.title: Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR)
content.definition: An advanced endovascular technique using custom-designed stent grafts with fenestrations (windows) or scallops to preserve blood flow to branch vessels while treating juxta- or pararenal aortic aneurysms.

concept.standard_evar_limitation: Requires adequate infrarenal neck (10-15 mm) for seal
concept.fevar_advantage: Extends proximal landing zone while preserving visceral vessels
concept.customization: Patient-specific graft design based on CT measurements

absolute: Allergy to contrast or device materials

fenestration_types.scallop: U-shaped opening at graft edge, accommodates vessels near planned seal zone

measurements: Clock position of each visceral vessel

access.brachial_axillary: Often needed for upper mesenteric/renal access

procedure_steps: Deploy main body with fenestrations aligned to target vessels
Catheterize each target vessel through fenestration
Deploy bridging stents into visceral branches
Complete distal extension with bifurcated or aorto-uniiliac components

branch_stenting.purpose: Creates seal between fenestration and branch vessel
branch_stenting.technique: Stent extends from aortic lumen into branch vessel

complications.endoleak: Type I, III more concerning than Type II

content.statement: Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Fenestrated-Evar that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR) helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR) include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR).

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

clinical_pearls: FEVAR = solution for short neck AAA unsuitable for standard EVAR
Custom devices require 4-8 weeks manufacturing time
Each fenestration requires a bridging stent into the target vessel
Upper extremity access often needed for catheterizing visceral vessels
Renal dysfunction in 10-20% - aggressive hydration essential
learning_objectives: Understand indications for FEVAR vs standard EVAR
Know fenestration types and their applications
board_review_points: FEVAR = for short neck AAA (<10-15mm infrarenal)
Fenestrations need bridging stents to branch vessels
Technical success >95%, branch patency >90% at 5 years

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Fenestrated Endovascular Aortic Repair (FEVAR). Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
